dublin_core.dcvalue: Specific legal issues arise from the distance of the participants in health telematics Substandard care not meeting the state of the art can yield malpractice litigation especially if a diagnosis or therapy conveyed via telematics proves to be deficient On the other hand communication deficiencies may bring about a reversal of the burden of proof If the patient s damage can not be attributed to the responsible person due to the division of labour a joint liability is likely to be adjudicated A specific legal risk analysis is required as a basis for a risk adequate design of any application in health telematics
